programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Many mysteries of planet Earth are far from understood. How was Devil's Tower formed? Or why do some people get struck by lightning multiple times?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: For centuries, fantastic tales of terrifying monsters have fascinated mankind; bizarre beasts of all shapes and sizes have been portrayed in some of history's most classic stories and folklore.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: We'll examine some of the most devastating plagues in human history, as well the scientific advances to combat them.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What motivates someone to steal? Is it just for the money, or could a criminal have other reasons for pulling off a particularly daring robbery?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Despite all of our modern technology, there are aspects of some vanishings that are bizarre and simply can't be explained.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Abandoned cities. Ancient cultures nearly erased by time. And colossal empires that simply vanished without a trace. How does a civilization become "lost?"

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: The murder of a vibrant 21-year-old leaves the peaceful community of Knoxville, Tennessee questioning its core values.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: Burlington, North Carolina--a town built on family, God, and Southern hospitality is shaken to its core when a local Sunday school teacher is brutally murdered.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: New York City, known for its diversity and acceptance, becomes the focus for a sadistic serial killer targeting the gay community.

programme.title: Evil Up Close

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Kim Edwards and Lucas Markham's romance was like something from a teen novel; together they made a cold-blooded plan to get rid of the mom and sister Kim bitterly resented.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Elizabeth Olten, nine, lived near Bustamante; Bustamante convinced her younger sister to bring Olten to the forest by their homes to play.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: A scorned lover serves her cheating lover his last-ever meal when he leaves her for another woman after a 16-year romance.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: In February 1971, nearly 30 years before Ivan Milat was convicted and sentenced to life in prison, a young woman was murdered on the outskirts of Canberra, Australia.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Forensic anthropologist and criminologist Dr Xanth Mallett and criminal psychologist Tim Watson-Munro have re-opened cold murder cases across New South Wales in Australia to piece together clues that may link the murders to serial killer Ivan Milat.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Forensic anthropologist and criminologist Dr Xanth Mallett and criminal psychologist Tim Watson-Munro go to the scene of Milat's known killing fields.

programme.desc: Providing prime-time context and analysis of the day's top stories, as well as in-depth reporting and storytelling from around the country and the globe.

programme.title: ABC World News Tonight With David Muir

Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin brings new life to old iron at his shop Joe Martin Customs; working with his wife Amanda, and best friend Shag, this custom shop oversees every phase of restoration from design, fabrication and mechanicals, to the final paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin puts the finishing touches on the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and arranges for the car to be delivered to the owner; Joe uses all his tricks to prepare a Chevrolet C10 for a charity auction with a stylish paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe dusts off his prized '65 Pontiac Catalina to give it the facelift it deserves -- new brakes, new trick frame and a bigger, badder LSA 600 horsepower motor. Meanwhile, Martin Bros. Customs tricks out the interior on an iconic 1932 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer from New York entrusts Joe with his prized 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew button up the 1965 Riviera's wiring, interior and paint.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian starts work on an all-aluminum Defender that has a Jeep JK chassis.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian installs more of the Defender's drivetrain, plus wheels and tires.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian creates his own short bed Jeep Gladiator by transforming a Jeep JK.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian modifies a 1998 Chevy T6500 for towing, overlanding and motorhoming.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian makes tons of custom parts to finish the All-Aluminum Defender project.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets a cheap Mercedes 300D ready for a local Gambler 500 rally.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since the Bronco is back, Ian pays homage to the very cool box-style Bronco of the past. He helps with the handling by adding an upgraded suspension, and adds new bumpers for a more aggressive look. Plus, he fixes some gremlins in the inline-six mot.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: How a factory two-door Toyota Tacoma can be made into the perfect off-road truck with the right axles and suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian continues the Tacoma project, but this time he completely reshapes the truck with a fiberglass body kit and truck cap, then cuts out the rear window to give it a vintage 4Runner look.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian takes the All-Aluminum Defender on the Kentucky Adventure Trail.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns a stack of tubes into a shorter trail chassis and adds new axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The mock-up on the trail chassis continues as Ian adds a motor and transmission to the build; it's time to get axles underneath with a new third member so he can go four-wheel drive all the time.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The guys test cars that are worlds apart in every way except horsepower.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The 2019 McLaren 600LT faces off against the 2019 Porsche GT3 RS.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jethro and Jonny pit BMW's mighty M2 against the ultralight Alpine A110.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro look at two of the last true hardcore production SUVs.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The Alfa Romeo Giulia Quadrifoglio is up against the Jaguar Project 8.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The MAT New Stratos and Superformance GT40 have one foot in the past.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro live out their touring fantasies in two British beasts.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The guys pit the legendary Shelby GT350 against the new Toyota Supra.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The 2019 Honda Civic Type R does battle with the 2020 Hyundai Veloster N.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The '19 Camaro ZL1 1LE goes up against the 2020 Lotus Evora.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro drive the BMW M5 Competition and the Mercedes-AMG GT 63 S.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Hypercars are still insane, but the idea of a supercar doesn't mean what it used to; a supercar is quiet, has room for family and friends, and delivers spine-crunching acceleration, plus exceptional range and even a luxurious driving experience.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Jeff and Jonny can't decide which supertruck is best, or even what the definition of supertruck is; they debate whether it's about how it looks, sounds or drives, horsepower/torque, whether it can be electric, and whether it can even do truck things.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: No EV maker has yet cracked the market for hot hatches; they're small, nimble, fun - all things EVs aren't; the guys turn to gasoline to figure out the best hot hatch on the market today: the Toyota GR Corolla or the Honda Civic Type R.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Exploring whether BMW maintains the title of undisputed fast sedan king.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Pitting the Rivian R1S against the Lamborghini Urus to find out which is best.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: MotorTrend's favorite talent competes in some fun holiday-spirit racing.

programme.title: Legendary Locations
programme.desc: Josh explores a millionaire's disappearance and an ancient city's collapse.

programme.title: Legendary Locations
programme.desc: Josh explores a millionaire's disappearance and an ancient city's collapse.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: The guys drive Audi's S1 Hoonitron, a car that's next level in all aspects.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike trek to Colorado for a 1971 Ford Crew Cab 4x4 tow truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's the mullet-car showdown, a battle of dirt-cheap beaters: an SN95 Mustang V-6 and a third-gen Camaro with a 305 that's so gutless it might as well be a V-6.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike test out the cars they've built that are still running.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill brings back a Mazda pickup powered by a 455 Oldsmobile in the bed!

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1950 Ford truck and add a Chevy transmission.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: People love it when the crew rescues old cars from the junkyard; they literally hack a '56 Buick Century out of a thorn bush it's been sitting in for 25 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike score a 1970 Dodge Challenger racer from a fan in Oregon.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1991 Cadillac Brougham is converted into the swingin' Broughammer with a Cummins turbodiesel; with special guests Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa of "Hot Rod Garage."

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1970 Dodge Challenger to a swap meet for speed parts.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Highlighting the Roadkill Boost Caboose, a trailer with an engine that powers a centrifugal supercharger that sends boost to the tow vehicle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys get a 1968 Datsun 520 mini truck and a 1971 Plymouth Road Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill fans always ask to see a competition with hosts David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan; they each buy a car for $1,500 and enter the Optima Ultimate Street Car Invitational in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike get together with the Mighty Car Mods, Marty and Moog.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan host from the annual Hot Rod Power Tour road trip including Roadkill project cars and a never-before-seen Hot Rod show video.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The mayhem is back complete with its new 707hp drivetrain from a 2015 Dodge Charger Hellcat; the off-road Hornet; the Disgustang; the Crusher Impala; time for big action.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan built (or unbuilt) the Vette Kart: an '85 Chevy Corvette stripped to nothing but a chassis and powertrain; now, it's back and the guys try to execute the least-predictable stunt ever.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.desc: Lamar Jackson had 3 fourth-quarter TD passes, and the Ravens stopped the Bengals on a 2-point conversion with 38 seconds remaining to hold them 35-34 on Thursday night. The Ravens rallied from a 21-7 third-quarter deficit.

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Black Diamond
programme.desc: At some point, we all have to choose a side: friends or family. This is a film about a diamond that was born a gem but raised as a savage.

programme.title: Black Girl Magic
programme.desc: Five hilariously talented black women from all walks of life deliver side-splitting comedy: New York's Brooklyn Jones, Los Angeles' Alycia Cooper, Chicago's Just Nesh, Milwaukee's Kelly Kellz and Atlanta's Ashima Franklin.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Four women struggle to cope with their sexual preferences: having sex with other women. Will they risk being themselves, even if it costs their lives?

programme.title: Blood or Not
programme.desc: Ten years with a squeaky clean record on the force, detective Ben Tucker isn't about to let his gangster brother Mike Mike take it all away.

programme.title: Boxed In 2
programme.desc: Rising boxing star Ria finds herself falling in love with a charming man, but the secrets that he keeps could destroy her future.

programme.title: Bunny and Clive
programme.desc: A down-and-out reporter gets the scoop of a lifetime when he secures an interview with the notorious crime duo that is holding him hostage.

programme.title: Bumher
programme.desc: When Jalisa Church finds her fianc Tim 24 hours after he proposes in bed with another, it leads her to find love in a very unusual way after meeting a man named Jacob Reaves.

programme.title: Bad for You
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agents loyalty is tested when she discovers that the new flame she just met is the target for her next assignment.

programme.title: American Girl
programme.desc: A young woman with political and social-justice aspirations finds herself trying to survive on the streets of Atlanta after running away from home.

programme.title: Glistening in the Snow
programme.desc: When struggling club owner Anaja finds out that her co-owner, Donovan, is coming to town for the holiday, she expects him to help keep the doors open. However, his fianc Addie wants him to sell the club. When the owners and staff are trapped in the club during a snow storm, they will have to work together to resolve their issues with each other.

programme.title: Devil's Kiss
programme.desc: Jaz and Taz are more than just sisters, they are two street assassins with a taste for money, respect and blood. After killing the brother of a local kingpin, Jaz and Taz find themselves on the run leaving a trail of drugs and betrayal.

programme.title: Kingsmen
programme.desc: Follows the story of the King family, a known crime syndicate. When their patriarch is killed, they fall under the wrath of a rival crime family, as well as the police. The four eldest brothers will do everything they can to protect their family.

programme.title: Swing
programme.desc: An aspiring jazz musician leaves 1945 Philadelphia for fame and fortune in Harlem when an audition sends him into a web of terror and violence.

programme.title: 10 Reasons Why Men Cheat
programme.desc: In the wake of a wedding catastrophe, three couples discover the meaning of commitment while discussing what women want to know most of all when it comes to men and relationships.

programme.title: Art of Love
programme.desc: After a government contracted hit goes wrong, the collateral damage causes Lucas Alba to retire. He may be done, but his past eventually catches up with him, putting his life in jeopardy.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors 2: Toxic Workplace
programme.desc: Newly hired employee Joy carries high hopes for success at her new marketing job, but her boss's intentions are anything but professional.

programme.title: Being on Top
programme.desc: Four women, Sophia Simmons, Dylan Carter, Portia Fitzgerald and Bridgette Barlow, who at the height of their careers are leaders in their industry, discover that having it all is easier said than done. Faced with the challenge of wanting both a professional and a personal life, they realize that life at the top can at times be isolating, and require sacrificing the authority and control they've earned professionally.

programme.title: Blood 4 Blood
programme.desc: Having lost her mom in a car wreck and then her dad to a couple of thugs, a young girl plots her vengeance for the eve of her high school graduation.

programme.title: Boxed In
programme.desc: Up-and-coming boxer Ria is focused only on her sportuntil she meets Tuga, and learns that a life without love really isn't a life at all.

programme.title: Busted and Disgusted
programme.desc: Promise is envious of Faith and her success, so she seeks to claim some of that happiness by any means necessary, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Code of Envy
programme.desc: Two lifelong friends find their close-knit relationship unraveling when a new member of their group is consumed with envy.

programme.title: Con Queens
programme.desc: After being betrayed by her closest friend, a woman sets out to break free from jail and get back control of her life.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe with new owners Martin and Hannah Weaver. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group stay at Sue's dog friendly Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth no one knows quite what to expect.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to East Linton in Scotland and the Crown and Kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The New Court Hotel in Usk, where manager Clare Davies is joined in the competition by the pub owner's mother, Fran Hancock. On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this weeks episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bons Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australias very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Amanda Byram, and the Big Red Balls are back!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring Worlds Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. Its all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. Nat with the Tats and Renee Lets get physical move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. Its a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Its a battle to the finish line when the Top 10 are tasked with a pasta race. The home cooks are divided into teams and compete to roll out the longest sheet of pasta as fast as they possibly can. The first teams pasta sheet to make it to the winners circle will be safe and exempt from a high-stakes elimination test in which clairs are the dish du jour. No detail will go unnoticed.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 10 participate in the seasons most crucial team challenge when the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR restaurant opens its doors to a special group of VIP female role models. The team that dishes up the most impressive meal will go straight into the Top 8, but its going to take more than skill to win over this exclusive group of guests. The losing team will face a Gordon Ramsay masterclass in which they will be tasked with replicating a three-Michelin-star-rated dish. See who advances.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The race to be the next MASTERCHEF JUNIOR shifts into full gear as the Top Eight pair up in the most intense mystery box challenge of the season, in which the chef-testants are challenged to pull off something highly creative and seriously delicious with corn. Only one will win a game-changing advantage that is certain to cause a ruckus in the tapas-themed, tag-team challenge. The best junior home cooks in America are put to the test.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Danielle and Andy in Teignmouth have a wonderful opportunity to create a delightful terraced garden in the back of their smart new home. The only problem is, they don't have the green fingers to do their garden justice.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.desc: Steve and Alice are after an Ibiza-flavoured outdoor space inspired by Alice's past living abroad. They have a budget of 2,500 and want a garden that will do justice to their new kitchen extension that spills outdoors through large bi-fold doors.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team look back at more floral highlights from the series, including alliums and auriculas, houseplants and creative containers, as well as the scented stars of the summer garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrate the joy that gardens and gardening can bring by looking back at some of their seasonal highlights. Monty Don harvests tomatoes from the greenhouse and plants out some of his favourite flowers for long-lasting summer colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britains seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Stomping Grounds Episode 5, our crew follows the road all the way down to where it ends on the tropical sun-baked island of Key West at the southern tip of the Florida Keys. Surrounded by water, Key West is a boater's paradise with historic seaports and marinas offering a bustling waterfront with historic schooners, dive boats, sport fishing charters, parasailing adventures and scenic coastal excursions. Host Ryan McVinney hops aboard a custom hybrid diesel-electric power catamaran with solar panels, called "Squid" for an in-depth eco-tour of Key West National Wildlife Refuge, including snorkeling in a sponge garden with tropical fish. Next a quick stop in Dry Tortugas National Park via the 110-foot Gladding Hearn power catamaran the "Yankee Freedom III" to visit historic Fort Jefferson, then we jump on a 2020 Sea Hunt 255 Ultra for a ride through the dolphin playground to a secret local boating spot known as Snipe Keys with pristine white sandbars. Back in town we we board the Nau Santa Maria - a replica of Christopher Columbus' sailboat. Finally we head 50 miles offshore to ply the wakes of the shrimp boats with fishing charter captain Chris Trosset aboard his Contender 35ST center console boat.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: The Primos Team hunts giant elk in the prairies and mountains of New Mexico.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Editor-in-Chief Dan Schmidt heads to Devil's Tower in Carlile, Wyoming for some close encounters of the whitetail kind.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isnt able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the Slam guy. He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. The goal in this episode is white management, which is something both Blake and John are passionate about. Blake has been hunting many years but what takes place in this hunt is a first.

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.title: The Break

programme.title: rmef
programme.desc: Well-known for producing some of the highest quality firearms for more than a century, the Browning X-Bolt can lift the average Joe hunter to the level of dead-eye marksman. To showcase how simple it can be, self-proclaimed average hunter Brandon Bates takes a brand new Browning X-Bolt right out of the box and goes to the range to see what this production rifle can do in custom rifle scenarios.

programme.title: TRP

He believes that everyone needs to be physically active to live life to the fullest, to be their best self and to operate at their highest capacity. programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Its the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Dj vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, its conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. programme.title: Storytellers

programme.desc: Couple faces the possibility of repairing a completely rotted 800-lb slide.

programme.title: Big Time RV
programme.desc: Check out a monster-sized RV with 4 TVs and a full bar for tailgating.

programme.title: Big Time RV
programme.desc: A couple wants a compact and luxurious RV fit for their growing toddler.

programme.title: Big Time RV
programme.desc: A cowboy searches for an RV suitable for his traveling rodeo lifestyle.

programme.title: Big Time RV
programme.desc: Adventurous newlyweds put away the tent and upgrade to a pop-up camper.

programme.title: The Mist
programme.desc: A storm unleashes bloodthirsty creatures on a small town, where a band of citizens hole up in a supermarket.

programme.title: Pandorum
programme.desc: Panic and terror come fast as two astronauts wake up in an empty spacecraft with no memory of what happened - except that an evil entity is waiting.

programme.title: Project Ithaca
programme.desc: Strangers awaken aboard an alien spacecraft. Divided they'll die. Together, they can find a way to stay alive.

programme.title: Cube

programme.title: Cube 2: Hypercube

programme.title: Cube Zero

programme.title: Penelope

programme.title: The Nanny Diaries
programme.desc: A struggling college graduate gets way more than she bargained for when she gets hired as a nanny for a neurotic and rich New York City client.

programme.title: Quartet

programme.title: The Sapphires
programme.desc: Four women become unlikely stars by singing for the troops in Vietnam with the help of an R&B-loving musician.

programme.title: La La Land

programme.title: The Stupids

programme.title: Mr. Nice Guy

programme.title: Home Fries

programme.title: Mr. Troop Mom

programme.title: Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control
programme.desc: Nate and Lloyd tumble through the world of espionage, as the duo scrambles to recover a nifty new invention.

programme.title: Sesame Street Presents: Follow That Bird
programme.desc: Big Bird runs away and all his old buddies join in the search to find him. Will Big Bird return home?

programme.title: Memoirs Of An Invisible Man
programme.desc: A nuclear accident turns a successful businessman invisible - a change that proves more of a burden than gift.

programme.title: That's My Boy
programme.desc: When Donny shows up uninvited on the eve of his estranged son's wedding, he is forced to face the repercussions of his history of bad parenting.

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Two mismatched partners, a pro boxer and a federal spy, must avoid international intrigue and deadly traps in order to get back an expensive jet.

programme.title: Blue Thunder

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: Runaway
programme.desc: A futuristic cop who works on broken robots discovers a plan to program them with artificial intelligence for murder, with his own son on the list.

programme.title: Solo
programme.desc: A powerful government killing machine with the appearance of a man carries out a series of missions. Soon, this being starts to grow a conscience.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: A tech geek expelled from school for pulling pranks on staff becomes the one person with enough savvy to rescue students from a gang of kidnappers.

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Two mismatched partners, a pro boxer and a federal spy, must avoid international intrigue and deadly traps in order to get back an expensive jet.

programme.title: That's My Boy
programme.desc: When Donny shows up uninvited on the eve of his estranged son's wedding, he is forced to face the repercussions of his history of bad parenting.

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: A rich woman and a communist sailor are stranded on a deserted Mediterranean island where, after some fights, they unexpectedly fall for each other.

programme.title: Love Letters
programme.desc: A U.S. Senator reflects back on his life after the death of a woman he loved dearly but left behind in order to pursue his political ambitions.

programme.title: The Razor's Edge
programme.desc: A WWI veteran is disillusioned by jazz-age values. He breaks off his engagement and goes on a journey that takes him through Paris and the Himalayas.

programme.title: Immediate Family
programme.desc: An upscale couple unable to conceive arrange a brokered adoption with a pregnant woman who doesnt hold up her end of the deal to give up the baby.

programme.title: North
programme.desc: After a judge allows him to sever ties to his work-obsessed parents, a boy embarks on an international quest for the quintessential set of parents.

programme.title: Quicksilver
programme.desc: Losing his shirt after a bad day on the market, a stock trader makes ends meet as a bicycle courier and uncovers sinister web of intrigue and murder.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: Lake Placid vs. Anaconda
programme.desc: Get ready for a non-stop bloodbath, unlike anything you've ever seen before in this heart-pounding battle between mutated crocodiles and anacondas.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finac, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: Girls Can Play
programme.desc: A detective investigates the murder of a player on a professional girl's softball team.

programme.title: Beyond Mombasa
programme.desc: A hard-drinking American travels to East Africa to find out what happened to his uranium-miner brother and find the parties responsible for his murder.

programme.title: There's Always a Woman
programme.desc: An investigator for the district attorney and his amateur sleuth wife compete to solve a murder mystery behind the death of a woman's husband.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: After a volcano erupts on a South Sea island, a fallen priest and three convicts race to save the lives of children in a mountaintop leper colony.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friends marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acua (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns hes engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: Doctor Faustus
programme.desc: Frustrated with the limits of his knowledge, Dr. Faustus calls upon Lucifer and offers his soul in return for 24 years of hedonism and invincibility.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang racking up $100,000 in credit card debtonly to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: The Last Rebel
programme.desc: Two Confederates (Joe Namath, Jack Elam) save a man's (Woody Strode) life and cause trouble in 1865 Missouri.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: California Conquest
programme.desc: A Spanish swashbuckler (Cornel Wilde) and a gunsmith's daughter (Teresa Wright) oppose a Russian plot to annex California.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: The Return of Wild Bill
programme.desc: Wild Bill Saunders comes home to help his father deal with troublesome ranchers.

programme.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Old West outlaw Bill Doolin (Randolph Scott) marries a deacon's wife, but his gang will not leave him alone.

programme.title: The Outlaws Is Coming
programme.desc: Moe, Larry and Curly Joe (Adam West) bring their head-knocking, eye-gouging antics to the Wild West. When reporter Kenneth Cabot (Nancy Kovack) heads to Wyoming to stop the slaughter of buffaloes, he brings the stooges with him. There, they trade barbs with Billy the Kid, Jesse James and Wild Bill Hickock, while Cabot gets elected town sheriff. But they'll need some help from Annie Oakley (Mort Mills) when it comes to foiling the criminal plans of a land-hungry frontier villain.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: The Walking Hills
programme.desc: During a poker game in a Mexican bar, a group of men discover the location of a lost wagon train -- and its cargo of gold. To prevent one man from cheating the rest, it's decided that they will find it together. Among them are horse breeder Jim Carey (Randolph Scott) and rodeo rider Shep Wilson (William Bishop) ; like their cohorts in the treasure hunt, they share a tangled history -- Chris Jackson (Ella Raines), Shep's current sweetheart, is Jim's old flame. Greed and suspicion soon break out.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: Love to Kill
programme.desc: The romance between a beautifully mysterious woman and a widower politician may become fatal if it turns out to be true that shes a black widow.

programme.title: Maternal Instinct
programme.desc: A teenage girl who sees her mother shot goes into hiding with a police detective who grows attached to her as she protects her from the killer who is hunting the girl.

programme.title: The New Wife
programme.desc: Its only been six months since Ruby Asher buried her husband and shes already chasing a new, wealthy manbut her game doesnt end with seduction.

programme.title: Secret Lives
programme.desc: A professor is forced to seek the truth about the husband she believed dead for ten years and the secret life he led, while someone tries to stop her.

programme.title: A Slice of Romance
programme.desc: When a vice president at a PR firm makes a deal with a coffee shop owner, she ends up getting more out of it than she had initially imagined.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: Love Again
programme.desc: A distant father (Kevin Sorbo) and a lost girlfriend to his best friend (Ben Davies) leads Nathan (Jason Burkey) on a journey of rediscovery.

programme.title: Love on the Reef
programme.desc: A marine biologist and a laissez-faire dive instructor must team up to save their beloved reef.

programme.title: Love Served Here
programme.desc: A chef bets she can turn around the worst restaurant in the city but ends up falling for the owner.

programme.title: Love on Retreat
programme.desc: Sparks fly between Jenny and Nate at a corporate retreat, despite him being her bosss brother.

programme.title: May the Best Wedding Win
programme.desc: Tiffany and her frenemy compete over wedding bookings, despite her not having a real fianc.

programme.title: Meet Me in New York
programme.desc: Events planner Kelly meets her match in web editor Joe when planning his niece's birthday party.

programme.title: Snowman's Pass
programme.desc: After a rock-climber falls and vanishes, an impresario offers his fiance high-tech help on her hunt, but his real aim is to find a spy satellite.
